ai-dn24:2.14.0_0: 6. On Describing the Origin of the World
ai-dn24:2.14.2_0: I understand this, and what goes beyond it. Yet since I do not misapprehend that understanding, I have realized extinguishment within myself. Directly knowing this, the Realized One does not come to ruin.
ai-dn24:2.14.3_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who describe the origin of the world in their tradition as created by the Lord God, by Brahmā.
ai-dn24:2.14.4_0: I went up to them and said:
ai-dn24:2.14.5_0: ‘Is it really true that this is the venerables’ view?’
ai-dn24:2.14.8_0: ‘But how do you describe in your tradition that the origin of the world came about as created by the Lord God, by Brahmā?’
ai-dn24:2.14.9_0: But they cannot answer, and they even question me in return.
ai-dn24:2.14.10_0: When I’m asked, I answered them:
ai-dn24:2.14.11_0: ‘There comes a time when, reverends, after a very long period has passed, this cosmos contracts.
ai-dn24:2.14.12_0: As it contracts, most sentient beings migrate to the realm of streaming radiance.
ai-dn24:2.14.13_0: There they are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the sky, steadily glorious, and they remain like that for a very long time.
ai-dn24:2.15.1_0: There comes a time when, after a very long period has passed, this cosmos expands.
ai-dn24:2.15.2_0: As it expanded he appears in an empty mansion of Brahmā.
ai-dn24:2.15.3_0: Then a certain sentient being with long life span or merit, and he was reborn in an empty mansion of Brahmā.
ai-dn24:2.15.4_0: There they are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the sky, steadily glorious, and they remain like that for a very long time.

ai-dn24:2.16.2_0: “Oh, if only another being would come to this state of existence.”
ai-dn24:2.16.3_0: Then other sentient beings—due to the running out of their life-span or merit—pass away from that host of radiant deities and are reborn in that empty mansion of Brahmā in company with that being.
ai-dn24:2.16.4_0: There they are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the sky, steadily glorious, and they remain like that for a very long time.

ai-dn24:2.21.10_0: I am quite confident that the Buddha
ai-dn24:2.21.10_1: is capable of teaching me so that I can enter and remain in the liberation on the beautiful.”
ai-dn24:2.21.11_0: “It’s hard for you to enter and remain in the liberation on the beautiful, since you have a different view, creed, preference, practice, and tradition.
ai-dn24:2.21.12_0: Come now, Bhaggava, carefully preserve the confidence that you have in me.”
ai-dn24:2.21.13_0: “If it’s hard for me to enter and remain in the liberation on the beautiful, since I have a different view, creed, preference, practice, and tradition,
ai-dn24:2.21.14_0: I shall carefully preserve the confidence that I have in the Buddha.”
ai-dn24:2.21.15_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-dn24:2.21.16_0: Satisfied, the wanderer Bhaggavagotta was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-dn24:2.21.17_0: The first section on the evening is finished.
